author: satya-rajesh
body:
+ cd /usr/src/BUILD
+ cd powershell-linux-7.0.0
+ cd /usr/src/BUILD/PowerShell-7.0.0
+ cp /usr/src/SOURCES/build.sh .
+ cp /usr/src/SOURCES/Microsoft.PowerShell.SDK.csproj.TypeCatalog.targets src
+ chmod +x ./build.sh
+ ./build.sh
+ for f in src/powershell-unix src/ResGen src/TypeCatalogGen
+ dotnet restore src/powershell-unix

Welcome to .NET Core 3.1!^M
---------------------^M
SDK Version: 3.1.201

Telemetry^M
---------^M
The .NET Core tools collect usage data in order to help us improve your experience. The data is anonymous. It is collected by Microsoft and shared with the community. You can opt-out of telemetry by setting the DOTNET_CLI_TELEMETRY_OPTOUT environment variable to '1' or 'true' using your favorite shell.^M
^M

Use 'dotnet --help' to see available commands or visit: https://aka.ms/dotnet-cli-docs^M
Write your first app: https://aka.ms/first-net-core-app^M
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
No usable version of libssl was found
./build.sh: line 6: 118072 Aborted                 (core dumped) dotnet restore $f
error: Bad exit status from /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.eQwRvn (%build)


RPM build errors:
    Bad exit status from /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.eQwRvn (%build)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: What is `./build.sh` you use? What is Unix version you use?

comments.author: satya-rajesh
comments.body:
build.sh has the following: #!/bin/bash #See https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/building/internals.md set -ex for f in src/powershell-unix src/ResGen src/TypeCatalogGen; do dotnet restore $f done pushd src/ResGen dotnet run popd pushd src cp Microsoft.PowerShell.SDK.csproj.TypeCatalog.targets Microsoft.PowerShell.SDK/obj dotnet msbuild Microsoft.PowerShell.SDK/Microsoft.PowerShell.SDK.csproj /t:_GetDependencies "/property:DesignTimeBuild=true;_DependencyFile=$(pwd)/TypeCatalogGen/powershell.inc" /nologo popd pushd src/TypeCatalogGen dotnet run ../System.Management.Automation/CoreCLR/CorePsTypeCatalog.cs powershell.inc popd # touch DELETE_ME_TO_DISABLE_CONSOLEHOST_TELEMETRY dotnet publish /property:GenerateFullPaths=true --configuration Linux --framework netcoreapp3.1 --runtime linux-x64 src/powershell-unix --output bin # Even after powershell rpm built, dotnet processes are alive, following to kill them: killall -15 dotnet
GitHub
PowerShell/PowerShell
PowerShell for every system! Contribute to PowerShell/PowerShell development by creating an account on GitHub.

comments.author: satya-rajesh
comments.body:
linux version is photon: https://github.com/vmware/photon/ I think powershell needs a compatibility with openssl 3.0 going forward - https://github.com/openssl/openssl/releases
GitHub
vmware/photon
Minimal Linux container host. Contribute to vmware/photon development by creating an account on GitHub.
GitHub
Releases · openssl/openssl
TLS/SSL and crypto library. Contribute to openssl/openssl development by creating an account on GitHub.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> I think powershell needs a compatibility with openssl 3.0 going forward

It is not PowerShell dependency - it is .Net dependency.

comments.author: satya-rajesh
comments.body:
> > I think powershell needs a compatibility with openssl 3.0 going forward
> 
> It is not PowerShell dependency - it is .Net dependency.

any suggestion how to get it working ? With previous openssl versions, there was no issue.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
You could discuss in .Net Runtime repo https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/search?q=openssl+3.0&type=issues

Update: you could ask .Net team for official supporting https://github.com/vmware/photon/. Only then PowerShell could be supported on Photon as well.

title: powershell does not compile with openssl 3.0 (currently at alpha) - unable to detect openssl version
